integer, intent(out)  ierr 
)

Subroutine to read data from a checkpoint file.

Parameters
arr3dimThe 3 dimentional array to write, usually concentration grid
temp2dimThe 2 dimensional array to write, usually the temperature grid
arr1dimThe 1 dimensional array to write, usually the free energy over time
fnName of the file to read from
use_inputThis is a flag that indicated is the input should override the checkpoint metadata
ierrA flag that checks if an error occured in reading

◆ read_checkpoint_metadata()

subroutine checkpointing::read_checkpoint_metadata ( character(len=*), intent(in)  fn,
character(len=*), intent(inout)  prob,
real(kind=real64), intent(inout)  initial_conc,
real(kind=real64), dimension(:), intent(inout), allocatable  coeffs,
integer, intent(inout)  Nx,
integer, intent(inout)  Ny,
real(kind=real64), intent(inout)  M1,
real(kind=real64), intent(inout)  M2,
real(kind=real64), intent(inout)  k,
real(kind=real64), intent(inout)  bfe,
integer, intent(inout)  Cint,
character(len=*), intent(inout)  cpo,
real(kind=real64), intent(inout)  t,
real(kind=real64), intent(inout)  delta_t,

real(kind=real64), intent(inout)  stab,
integer, intent(out)  ierr 
)

Subroutine to read metadata from a checkpoint file.

Parameters
probProblem that will be computed (spectral, constant, nontemp, temp)
coeffsCoefficients of the polynomial used for bulk potential
cpoName of the checkpoint out file
initial_concInitial average concentration of the grid
nxX dimension of the grid
nyY dimension of the grid
m1Mobility of the first species
m2Mobility of the second species
kThe charecteristic lengthscale of transition region
bfeBulk free energy paramter
CintCheckpoint interval
tFinal time to run simulation till
time_stepTime step
current_iterThe interation at which the checkpoint was written
random_seedSeed used for the simulation
lastwThe interation where the output was last written
write_freqThe frequency at which frames are written
write_freq_cA counter that is saved so the calculation can continue
write_countA counter that is saved so the calculation can continue
singlA flag that tells the code to save in single single precision
fnName of the file to read from
use_inputThis is a flag that indicated is the input should override the checkpoint metadata
ierrA flag that checks if an error occured in reading
stabA stabilization term that allows for bigger timesteps at the const of inital accuracy (spectral)
